title: Poster, "Pinwheel", ca. 1980
inscribed: Printed in rust, lower margin: POSTER DESIGN: WOODY PIRTLE, INC./COPY: MARY KECK/TYPE: TYPOGRAPHICS/PAPER: MCNARCH PAPER CO./PRINTING: NEWMAN & MELTON
description:
Poster depicts a house shape framed in purple containing two boxes of text on either side; above, in purple: PINWHEEL; Text boxes: Aha! Rust really does / it. But would red by richer? Would purple / pop? Now it’s easy / to actually see all the / choices your imagine. / With Typographic’s / Pinwheel. It’s a / new color proof pro- / cess that works kind of / like sild screen. For af- / fordable color trials / and presentation cali- / bre super compos. And / even for short runs of 2- / 200 or more. But / Pinwheel has made [next box] lots of improvements / over old-fashioned sild / screen methods. All in / the name of quality. / So you can spin the / color wheel and bring / a whole new spectrum / of possibilities to life. / Because no matter / how right rust is, some- / times your wonder, / would dark green do / more? Pinwheel.
The house shape contains a hand holding up a green pinwheel, all with saw tooth border on rust-colored ground. Above, one letter in each circle: COLOR.

tombstone.epitaph: Poster, "Pinwheel", ca. 1980. Lithograph on paper. Gift of Various Donors. 1981-29-185.
